Key Match Events: Conor Bradley had the ball in the net in the 9th minute, but was offside
Paddy McNair sent his header wide in the 15th minute
Trai Hume's range of passing was on full show and a superb ball picked out Reid

Eoin Toal must have thought he had his first Northern Ireland goal in the 39th minute when he flicked a Shea Charles free-kick goalwards, only to see the ball come off the post before Belarus scrambled it away
Post-Match Reflections: Northern Ireland failed to make their chances pay as they were held to a frustrating 0-0 Nations League draw by Belarus
Miscellaneous Highlights: Belarus made it seven clean sheets in their last nine competitive games
19-year-old goalkeeper Pierce Charles enjoyed a quiet night on his debut, with he and midfielder Shea becoming the 23rd set of brothers to play for Northern Ireland or Ireland
